pullrequest.title: Issue#96 Add Thrust Angle and Rotation Joint

content.raw:
in [http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/14793/how-to-set-a-joint-position-and-and-a-joint-force-at-the-same-time-is-it-feasible-with-the-current-api/](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/14793/how-to-set-a-joint-position-and-and-a-joint-force-at-the-same-time-is-it-feasible-with-the-current-api), it is mentioned that

_In general, you don't want to use \`SetPosition\` on a joint. The \`SetPosition\` function bypasses the physics engine, and performs some teleportation of child links. You should apply forces to joints and write a controller to achieve desired joint angles_

I feel that my implementation is working and is all we need, but do you think it is better to use forces with PID control to move joints or simply move them the way I have?

PID control of joints: [http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/2341/set-and-get-position-of-gazebo-model-using-ros-plugin/](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/2341/set-and-get-position-of-gazebo-model-using-ros-plugin/)
